article_title: Federal cuts for Florida healthcare mean hospitals — including Jackson Memorial — could lose millions
article_text:
Florida lawmakers knew the cuts were coming since last year

Money to care for uninsured will drop from $1.1 billion to $600 million

Jackson could lose at least $23 million, but other nonprofits such as Baptist could gain new dollars

article_metadata.news-keywords: Jackson Health System, Jackson Memorial Hospital, Affordable Care Act, Obamacare, Low Income Pool, Disproportionate Share Hospital, LIP, DSH, uninsured, hospitals, Florida, Medicaid, Medicaid expansion
article_metadata.description: Facing deep cuts to a hospital payment program, Florida lawmakers created a new model for distributing the diminished dollars. Jackson Memorial’s loss could range from $24 million to much more.
article_metadata.title: Federal cuts for Florida healthcare mean hospitals — including Jackson Memorial — could lose millions | Miami Herald
